channel.title: Posts on Geeky Geekery
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Geeky Geekery

item.title: How to post facebook programmingly?
item.description: Recenyly, my side project needs to post to facebook page automatically. I found that facebook provides a Graph API to do this. Here is the steps to post to facebook page programmingly.

item.title: When Proxy Matters
item.description: Proxy? VPN? What’s that? # A VPN (Virtual Private Network) is a technology that creates a secure connection over a public network, such as the internet. A proxy, on the other hand, is a server that acts as an intermediary for requests from clients seeking resources from other servers.

item.title: Repository Structure in a Sole Nx Experimental Module
item.description: Preface # Some of my readers already know that I’m a scraper engineer in my daily job. My team migrated from a monolithic to a monorepo architecture almost 10 months ago, and I still believe it was the best decision we made last year.

item.title: Install Disqus on Hugo Blog
item.description: Preface # What is the most important thing for a tech blog besides posting? It’s interaction to me. Why? Because if we don’t interact with our readers, we won’t know what they think about our post.

item.title: Create a Personal Webpage with Astro & TinaCMS
item.description: Preface # When I was thinking about my personal webpage as creator. I choose Nextjs plus TinaCMS as my tech stack. However I didn’t find the suitable theme or template about that.

item.title: Publish a Static Website on CloudFlare Pages with Custom Domain
item.description: As a follow-up to my last post, I will be moving my tech blog (the one you’re reading now) to CloudFlare Pages with a custom domain that I bought on CloudFlare Domains.

item.title: Blowfish a Hugo Blog and Deployed to Github Pages
item.description: Since I started as an engineer, I heard many seniors say that the fastest way for an engineer to grow is by writing a technical blog and doing side projects.
